name: Starting Point for Context
rule: When beginning a new task or trying to understand a situation, the best place to start is by reviewing the Git commits and their associated timestamps. This provides the most reliable historical context for the project's evolution.
path_to_scripting: This rule can be implemented as a script that is run at the beginning of a new task. The script would execute `git log -n 10` (or a similar command) to retrieve the recent commit history. The agent's LLM would then be prompted to review this history and to use it as a starting point for understanding the current state of the project. This script could be part of a larger 'context gathering' workflow that also includes reading relevant files and project documentation.
